name: JDM Tuner Racing
description: The game is a 2D simulation of drag racing. It has a very realistic 2D physics, the car's realistic behavior and unpredictable opponent! The game has an opportunity to upgrade your car to the full! You can set the visual details to your car, putting a body kit or rear wing you improves the aerodynamics of your car!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Intel Celeron, Pentium 4 Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GT210 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Celeron, Pentium 4 Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GT630 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 300 MB available space

I got this game for free, which is a good thing because it's basically a copy of a old free flash game called Drag racer V3
This game lacks features, it appears to re-use assets from the dev's other games, and after a while, becomes a chore to grind for cash and exp. Pointless game that doens't offer any gameplay.

The only option in this game is resolution in the base menu. This game is LOUD The menus are terrible. (The 'Engine' icon takes you to the upgrade page.) There is nothing to this game and there are only around 5 buttons you'll have to ever press.  It's not even bad, it's terrible, tedious, and monotonous. It takes too long to level up even if you're winning every or almost every race. You'd have more fun printing a picture of a car and making engine noises as you move it around your room.
